title: Sheridan Smith 'confirms pregnancy news' during cruise ship performance
text:
Sheridan Smith is thought to have confirmed her pregnancy (Picture: PA / Instagram)

Sheridan Smith has reportedly confirmed her pregnancy, while performing on a cruise ship.

The 38-year-old, who is engaged to fiancé Jamie Horn, previously sparked speculation she was expecting her first child, when she referenced ‘morning sickness’ on Instagram.

And the Gavin And Stacey actress is thought to have let slip during her performance on musical theatre cruise, Stages 2019.

According to reports, the delighted ‘mum-to-be’ told the audience: ‘I’ve got a baby on board,’ while stroking her ‘baby bump’.

She is also rumoured to have told the crowd she is suffering from the ‘morning sickness lark’, before explaining they had taken precautions for if she needed to make a quick exit to use the toilet.

‘I’ve got buckets in each wing and trainers so I can run,’ the Mirror states she added. ‘I’m very out of breath. I’ve got all these new symptoms, so sorry!’

Sheridan reportedly told the crowd she has a ‘baby on board’ (Picture: PA)

Sheridan has yet to confirm the news publicly, but did have tongues wagging over her ‘morning sickness’ tease on Instagram.

Taking to Instagram, she shared a picture of her VIP passes for the cruise, while telling her 304k followers: ‘About to set sail for four days, wish me luck with my morning sickness.’

Right on cue, fans rushed to ask whether the mention of morning sickness was her way of announcing her baby news.

‘Morning sickness?!’ one fan questioned. ‘Huge congratulations xxxx.’

While another commented: ‘Omg are you having a baby.. if so congratulations.’

An Instagram user added: ‘Baby on the way? Xx.’

Sheridan and Jamie started dating at the beginning of last year, after meeting on Tinder.

The Cilla actress delighted fans after announcing their engagement, just three months later.

The pair started dating last year (Picture: Instagram)

However, she was recently forced to hit out at claims they had secretly tied the knot, after they were spotted wearing bands on their wedding finger.

As you do.

Addressing all the speculation during an appearance on This Morning, she explained: ‘I do wear two bands on my hand, but mainly but this one is too big and it does keep it on.

‘But Jamie does wear his wedding ring, we’re not actually married, we just do it. My friends do that but no one actually talks about it.

‘We didn’t think about it when we took a picture and put it on Twitter and then of course everyone thought that we were married.’

So that’s that, then.

Metro.co.uk has contacted Sheridan’s reps for a comment.
